{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3458846,"name":"Will C","username":"Suppdog222","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/suppdog222/{size}/256515_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-13T14:41:17.073Z","cooked":"

Is it better to use white lithium grease, or the red n tacky grease for greasing the gears on swerve pods? What are the differences between the 2?

Also does your team use any pod covers to keep the gears clean and protect your mk4 pods? If so can you include the cad?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-12-13T17:06:57.067Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":50,"reads":471,"readers_count":470,"score":344.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":476637,"topic_slug":"sds-mk4-gear-grease","display_username":"Will C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66211,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design"},"post_url":"/t/sds-mk4-gear-grease/476637/1","custom_user_title":"3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3458848,"name":null,"username":"AvisAutomata5826","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avisautomata5826/{size}/237369_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-13T14:49:22.444Z","cooked":"

We just use Lucas oil white lithium grease for the gears and we made custom covers for our MK4 kits which have helped a ton in reducing the gunk. We like white lithium more than the red grease because the red grease literally gets everywhere and is harder to clean after it’s applied. We’ve used the same gearing set since fall of 2020 and still have minimal wear on our stuff. Just make sure to take all the used modules apart after each competition, inspect bearings, clean gears, check wear, and order parts if needed. They will last far longer if you do proper maintenance.

We use white lithium and have no failures (SDS units).
Here is a link to more details on our swerve covers which keep our gears and x-contact bearings healthy:

Swerve cover design CAD
We (1699) made snap-on swerve covers (Mk4 and Mk4i). You might get some ideas from our designs. They simply clip onto the vertical spacers of the swerve units and were inspired by the clever design of Ajax Bachor . However, our design fully encloses the gearing of the MK4i units. Further, the covers accommodate 40mm muffin fans with snap-on filters to slightly pressurize the swerve units with clean air to keep carpet debris and other junk out, particularly out of the x-contact bearing. We have…

image1920×1440 178 KB

Both red and tacky and white lithium are lithium based greases. White has zinc oxide and is more water resistant. Red and Tacky allegedly has more EP additives. My vote is slightly for the red and tacky. We have also use a spray on dry Moly grease ( CRC 3084 Dry Moly Lube for example) on the bevel gears. It needs to be reapplied often.
